intro: Micromeles folgneri, commonly known as the Mexican mountain bean, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. It has compound leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
